text:
Is there something that can ease referring to elements of Dicts inside Dicts?
Here’s an example I got when reading in a Kubernetes YAML file with YAML.jl, printed with PrettyPrinting:
```d = Dict("kind" => "Deployment",
     "spec" =>
         Dict("template" =>
                  Dict("spec" => Dict("containers" =>
                                          [Dict("name" => "nginx",
                                                "image" => "nginx:1.14.2",
                                                "ports" =>
                                                    [Dict("containerPort" =>
                                                              80)])]),
                       "metadata" => Dict("labels" => Dict("app" => "nginx"))),
              "selector" => Dict("matchLabels" => Dict("app" => "nginx")),
              "replicas" => 2),
     "metadata" => Dict("name" => "nginx-deployment"),
     "apiVersion" => "apps/v1")```
Now I can write this, but it’s kind of ugly:
```d["spec"]["template"]["spec"]["containers"][1]["ports"][1]["containerPort"]```

elements.text:
Is there something that can ease referring to elements of Dicts inside Dicts?
Here’s an example I got when reading in a Kubernetes YAML file with YAML.jl, printed with PrettyPrinting:

d = Dict("kind" => "Deployment",
     "spec" =>
         Dict("template" =>
                  Dict("spec" => Dict("containers" =>
                                          [Dict("name" => "nginx",
                                                "image" => "nginx:1.14.2",
                                                "ports" =>
                                                    [Dict("containerPort" =>
                                                              80)])]),
                       "metadata" => Dict("labels" => Dict("app" => "nginx"))),
              "selector" => Dict("matchLabels" => Dict("app" => "nginx")),
              "replicas" => 2),
     "metadata" => Dict("name" => "nginx-deployment"),
     "apiVersion" => "apps/v1")
Now I can write this, but it’s kind of ugly:

text:
With different YAML options I saved some characters, but this isn’t in reality any better.
```data[:spec][:template][:spec][:containers][1][:ports][1][:containerPort]```

elements.text: With different YAML options I saved some characters, but this isn’t in reality any better.

text:
about the best you can do is to define a/some variable[s] that gets you where you need to  be:
```spec = d["spec"]["template"]["spec"]
 spec["containers"][1]
Dict{String, Any} with 3 entries:
  "name"  => "nginx"
  "image" => "nginx:1.14.2"
  "ports" => [Dict("containerPort"=>80)]

julia>  spec["containers"][1]
Dict{String, Any} with 3 entries:
  "name"  => "nginx"
  "image" => "nginx:1.14.2"
  "ports" => [Dict("containerPort"=>80)]```

  "image" => "nginx:1.14.2"
  "ports" => [Dict("containerPort"=>80)]

julia>  spec["containers"][1]
Dict{String, Any} with 3 entries:
  "name"  => "nginx"
  "image" => "nginx:1.14.2"
  "ports" => [Dict("containerPort"=>80)]
